config.question: Which of the following was the first permanent European settlement in the area that became the United States?

choices.content: the Spanish settlement of St. Augustine
the French colony of New Orleans

answer_3.response: Concern over French encroachment in the Southeast led Spain to colonize St. Augustine (Florida) in 1565. This was the first permanent European settlement in what would become the United States, predating the founding of Jamestown and Plymouth by decades.
